metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9942 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in ultra.c in LibVNCClient in LibVNCServer before 0.9.11 allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted FramebufferUpdate message with the Ultra type tile, such that the LZO payload decompressed length exceeds what is specified by the tile dimensions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

italc-client - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libvncclient1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.1
libvncserver-config - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: italc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1').
libvncserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.1').
